result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsey Noel Sandine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the sentences may be served with huber and are to be consecutive to each other.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.  If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive credit for 2 days served.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction has been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to Forward.
from Pathway Home

10:23 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1,2 & 3 on 2015CF90 and count 4 will be dismissed and read -in.  Defendant will plea to count 1 on 2016CM35 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1, 2 & 3 as charged on 2015CF90 and orders count 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2016CM35 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CM35

30 day county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS: (all counts)

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-DNA sample

2015CF90

Count 1 - 90 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.
Count 2 - 30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.
Count 3 - 180 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS - see above.

If the sentences are to be served, Court orders them to be consecutive to each other, with huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit on 2015CF90 if probation becomes revoked.

Court adjourned at  10:36 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Court adjourned at 3:18 P.M.
